Class Rational

  • java.lang.Object
    • Rational

  • public class Rational
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a rational number.
    Author:
    Ch. H. Modified by H. W. A

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rational

        public Rational()
        The default constructor for objects of class Rational. Creates the rational number 1.

      • Rational

        public Rational(int n,
        int d)
        The alternate constructor for objects of class Rational. Creates a rational number equivalent to n/d.
        Parameters:
        n - The numerator of the rational number.
        d - The denominator of the rational number.

      • negate

        public Rational negate()
        Negate a rational number r
        Returns:
        a new rational number that is negation of this number -r

      • invert

        public Rational invert()
        Invert a rational number r
        Returns:
        a new rational number that is 1/r.

      • add

        public Rational add(Rational other)
        Add two rational numbers
        Parameters:
        other - the second argument of the add
        Returns:
        a new rational number that is the sum of this and the other rational

      • subtract

        public Rational subtract(Rational other)
        Subtract a rational number t from this one r
        Parameters:
        other - the second argument of subtract
        Returns:

      • multiply

        public Rational multiply(Rational other)
        Multiply two rational numbers
        Parameters:
        other - the second argument of multiply
        Returns:

        public Rational divide(Rational other)
        Divide this rational number r by another one t
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a new rational number that is r/t
